name: Device payload
Configure Publish to IoT for your environment
info:
1. Double click the node.
2. Click the edit icon next to the Server field.
3. Update the Server name to correspond to your Watson IoT Platform organization.
 `organization_ID.messaging.internetofthings.ibmcloud.com`

4. Update the Client ID with your orgainzaiton ID, device type, and device ID:
 `d:organization_ID:device_type:device_ID`

5. Click the Security tab.
6. Verify that the Username field has the value use-auth-token.
7. Update the Password field with the Authentication Token that you saved earlier.
8. Click Update and then OK.
9. In the upper right corner of the Node-RED flow editor, click Deploy.

name: Function Node
info:
The Function node allows you to pass each message though a JavaScript function.

The Javascript function creates the message payload that is sent to your Watson IoT Platform organization.

name: Debug Node
info: The Debug node causes any message to be displayed in the Debug sidebar. By default, it just displays the payload of the message, but it is possible to display the entire message object.

name: Inject Node
info: The Inject node allows you to inject messages into a flow, either by clicking the button on the node, or setting a time interval between injects.
